newsitem.title: USA: Paracelsian AndroVir cut HIV load in trial.
newsitem.headline: Paracelsian AndroVir cut HIV load in trial.

text.p: Paracelsian Inc said Thursday that preliminary results showed the HIV viral load fell in 13 HIV-positive people who completed a clinical safety trial of AndroVir.
Paracelsian is seeking to market AndroVir, a herb-based product, as a dietary supplement for HIV-positive people.

The company said three of 16 people in the trial withdrew after experiencing a bitter taste and an allergic reaction. But there was a 38 percent median drop in HIV viral load of the 13 people who finished the trial, and a 31 percent median increase in CD4 cell counts, a measure of immune function, the company said.
The company said it will further test AndroVir to determine dosage regimens. The company said the product cost should be less than $1,000 a year, based on the dose ranges it is considering.
